noun.description: The action of retender; an instance of this.

verb.description: To submit a second or subsequent tender for a proposed contract, etc.
To issue a second or subsequent request for tenders on (a proposed contract, etc.).

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Albany Law Journal. From re- + tender, after retender<br>early 17th century; earliest use found in Barnabe Barnes (bap. 1571, d. 1609), poet and playwright. From re- + tender.
